New Records: Lionel Messi now holds the record for the most appearances in Copa America history
Key Match Events: Julian Alvarez scored the first goal in the 48th minute
Lautaro Martinez scored the second goal in the 87th minute
Argentina controlled 64.5 per cent of the possession, outshot the Canadians 19-10 (9-2 on target), and had seven corner kicks to Canada's four
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina are heading into their Copa America opener behind four consecutive wins in international friendlies
Lionel Messi will wear the captain's armband as he leads his team against Canada
Argentina fans are making their presence felt outside Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina secured a 2-0 win over Canada to gain three points and top position in Group A
Lautaro Martinez proved to be the super sub as he doubles Argentina's lead in the 87th minute
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina had 15 fouls to their opposition's nine
Crepeau was the busier keeper, making six saves to Martinez's two
Both teams had two yellow cards
